title: Jozani Forest, Red Colobus & Mangroves
shortDescription: A quiet morning or afternoon in Zanzibar's natural forest, walking shaded paths to see red colobus monkeys and coastal mangroves.
description:
This gentle half-day trip takes you to Jozani–Chwaka Bay National Park to see one of Zanzibar's last pockets of natural forest.

A local guide leads you along simple forest paths to look for Zanzibar red colobus monkeys and other small wildlife. Afterwards you walk a short mangrove boardwalk to see how the coastal forest meets the tides. The outing fits easily into a morning or afternoon and can be combined with a spice farm or village visit if you would like a fuller day.

Guided forest walks with insight into local conservation efforts
Mangrove boardwalk exploring Zanzibar's coastal ecosystems

Can be combined with a spice farm or village visit for a fuller day

title: Kizimkazi Dolphins & Turtle Sanctuary
shortDescription: An early morning on the south coast, watching dolphins from a respectful distance, then time with rescued turtles in clear water.
description:
This south-coast morning starts early so you can enjoy softer light and quieter seas around Kizimkazi.

You board a small boat and head out to look for local dolphin pods using a respectful, low-impact approach that avoids chasing or crowding them. When conditions and behaviour allow, you may be able to enter the water nearby for a short, carefully managed swim and snorkel.

After the boat returns to shore you visit Salaam Cave Aquarium, where a clear natural pool is home to rescued sea turtles. You can watch from the edge or choose to swim with them for a short time before a simple tea stop and your drive back to the hotel.

Your captain chooses snorkelling spots near the protected reefs around Mnemba, aiming for clear water and easy currents. There is a chance to see dolphins along the way, always with a gentle, non-intrusive approach.

Between swims you can relax on the boat with light snacks and soft drinks, watching the colours of the lagoon and open sea before returning to shore and then to your hotel.

title: Prison Island Tortoises & Nakupenda Sand
shortDescription: A calm day on the water, visiting giant tortoises on Prison Island, then time to swim and rest on a quiet sandbank.
description:
This day gives you a mix of simple history and open sea. You start with a short boat ride from Stone Town to Prison Island (Changuu), where you visit the Aldabra giant tortoises and walk a little around the old buildings.

Afterwards the boat continues to Nakupenda, a long sandbank that appears with the tide. Here there is time to swim in shallow water, walk on the sand and sit under simple shade. A light lunch is usually served on or near the sandbank, with soft drinks and water.

In the afternoon you return by boat to Stone Town and then on to your hotel, normally by late afternoon.

title: Spice Farm, Senses & Simple Life
shortDescription: A gentle inland visit to see, smell and taste spices growing in the countryside, with time to understand how they're used.
description:
This is a gentle inland trip for guests who enjoy food and simple local life. You travel to a small spice farm where a guide shows you different trees and plants such as cloves, cinnamon, cardamom and vanilla.

You are encouraged to touch, smell and taste along the way, with clear explanations of how each spice grows and how it is used at home. The visit usually ends with a small fruit tasting and the option to buy a few packets to take home.

This outing can stand alone as a half-day or be combined with Stone Town or Jozani for a fuller day.

title: Safari Blue, Done the Unrushed Way
shortDescription: A calm day on the Indian Ocean, sailing by traditional dhow, shaped around the tides, the light, and the natural rhythm of the sea.
description:
You arrive at Fumba in the morning and step onto a traditional wooden dhow, joining a small group hosted by the Savana Blu team. The crew sets sail into Menai Bay, choosing where to anchor based on the day's conditions—the clarity of the water, the movement of the tide, the feel of the wind.

There is time to snorkel in shallow water, to rest on a sandbank when the tide allows, and to simply be on the boat watching the colours of the lagoon. A simple seafood lunch is served on or near a small island, with space to sit and pause rather than rush between stops.

In the afternoon you sail back towards Fumba at a gentle pace. The atmosphere stays quiet and unhurried—no loud music, no crowded boats nearby. You return to your hotel by late afternoon, with the sense of having spent a day on the water rather than ticking off a list of activities.

title: Four Days: Town, Turtles, Sandbanks & Mnemba
shortDescription: Four well-paced days connecting Stone Town's heritage, swimming with turtles, a sunset dhow, Prison Island and sandbanks, and Mnemba snorkelling.
description:
This 4-day plan is designed for guests who want the main highlights in a short stay.

Day 1 – Stone Town and night market. You start with a heritage walk through Stone Town, then return in the evening for a hosted visit to the waterfront and night market, with your host helping you choose snacks and move through the stalls.

Day 2 – Turtles and sunset dhow. The second day focuses on the north coast with a visit to a turtle aquarium and a relaxed sunset dhow cruise along the shoreline.

Day 3 – Prison Island and Nakupenda sandbank. On day three you take a boat from Stone Town to Prison Island to see the Aldabra tortoises, then continue to Nakupenda sandbank for swimming and time on the sand with a simple lunch.

Day 4 – Mnemba snorkelling. The final day heads out towards Mnemba for reef snorkelling in clear water, with a chance of seeing dolphins along the way if conditions and behaviour allow.
